Package ePortfolio

Class Portfolio

  • java.lang.Object
    • ePortfolio.Portfolio
  • public class Portfolio
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains the investments bought by the user.

      • main

      • CreateWindow

      • Buy

        public static java.lang.String Buy​(java.lang.String inType,
                                   java.lang.String inSymbol,
                                   java.lang.String inName,
                                   java.lang.String inQuantity,
                                   java.lang.String inPrice)
                            throws java.lang.Exception
        Allows the user to buy new or preexisting investments. Searches for if investment exists according to user input. If investment exists, user is allowed to purchase additional shares/units, if the type inputted is the same as the investments. Else, the inputted name is used for the new investment and the hashmap is updated.
        Parameters:
        inType - The type of Investment to buy/add to.
        inSymbol - The symbol of the new/existing Investment.
        inName - The name of the new/existing Investment.
        inQuantity - The quantity to buy of the Investment.
        inPrice - The price to buy an Investment at.
        Returns:
        A string representing the results of the operation.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Possible exceptions can occur from no investments existing within the portfolio or from input values being invalid. An exception is thrown with a WARNING message if the user wished to purchase a Stock/Mutual Fund but there was an existing Investment with a differing type.

      • Sell

        public static java.lang.String Sell​(java.lang.String inSymbol,
                                    java.lang.String inQuantity,
                                    java.lang.String inPrice)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        Allows the user to sell an existing investment. Searches for if inputted symbol exists, and sells if all other input info is valid. Updates hashmap if investment was completely sold.
        Parameters:
        inSymbol - The symbol of the Investment to sell.
        inQuantity - The amount of the Investment to sell.
        inPrice - The price to sell the Investment at.
        Returns:
        A string representing the results of the operation.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Possible exceptions can occur from no investments existing within the portfolio, invalid inputs for the parameters, or cases where quantity to sell is larger than current quantity.

      • Update

        public static java.lang.String Update​(java.lang.String symbol,
                                      java.lang.String name,
                                      java.lang.String inPrice)
                               throws java.lang.Exception
        Allows the user to update the prices of an investment within their portfolio.
        Parameters:
        symbol - The symbol of the Investment to update.
        name - The name of the Investment to update.
        inPrice - The new price for the Investment.
        Returns:
        A string representing the results of the operation.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Possible exceptions can occur if no investments exist within the portfolio, or if an invalid input is received for the symbol, name (being blank) or inPrice (i.e., negative, or non-numeric values).

      • GetGain

        public static float GetGain()
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Calculates the amount of payment received provided that the user were to sell all investments currently held at their current price.
        Returns:
        The total gain from selling all investments.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - An exception can be thrown if no investments exist within the portfolio.

      • GetGain

        public static float GetGain​(int index)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Calculates the amount of payment received provided that the user were to sell the Investment at index.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the Investment to calculate.
        Returns:
        The gain from selling the Investment at index.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - An exception can be thrown if no investments exist within the portfolio or if the passed index exceeds the bounds of the ArrayList.

      • Search

        public static java.lang.String Search​(java.lang.String inSymbol,
                                      java.lang.String inName,
                                      java.lang.String inLPrice,
                                      java.lang.String inHPrice)
                               throws java.lang.Exception
        Allows the user to search for investments within their portfolio by symbol, name, or price.
        Parameters:
        inSymbol - The symbol of the Investment to search for.
        inName - The name of the Investment to search for.
        inLPrice - The lower bound to search for.
        inHPrice - The higher bound to search for.
        Returns:
        A string representing the result of the operation.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Possible exceptions can occur if there are not existing investments, or if inputs were invalid (such as inputting a String of non-numeric values for inLPrice or inHPrice).

      • OnUpdateHashMap

        private static void OnUpdateHashMap​(java.lang.String name)
        Handles the addition and deletion of investments from portfolio and their relation (by keyword) to the hashmap. Gets a list of keywords by the space-separated words from the 'name' parameter. Adds keyword(s) and (ArrayList of type Integer) value to hashmap in the case of new investments. Replaces keyword(s) and (ArrayList of type Integer) value in hashmap, in the case of new investments with the one or more of the same keyword or the deletion of an investment with a keyword linked to other investments. Deletes keyword(s) and (ArrayList of type Integer) value in hashmap, in the case of no matches being made to any keywords found in investments of portfolio.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of Investment object.

      • UpdateHashMap

        private static void UpdateHashMap​(java.lang.String nameToDelete)
        Calls OnUpdateHashMap(...) over all investments in portfolio, using each investments' name as the parameter for OnUpdateHashMap(...).
        Parameters:
        nameToDelete - Calls OnUpdateHashMap(name) to attempt to delete the keywords of 'name'.

      • InvestmentExists

        public static boolean InvestmentExists()
        Determines whether the portfolio has any existing investments.
        Returns:
        Boolean value indicating whether portfolio has any investments.

      • GetBySymbol

        private static int GetBySymbol​(java.lang.String symbol)
        Attempts to get an investment by its symbol. Compares investments' symbols against argument 'symbol', ignoring character case.
        Parameters:
        symbol - The symbol to search for.
        Returns:
        The index of the investment found, or -1 to indicate no match.

      • GetByPrice

        private static boolean GetByPrice​(float lowBound,
                                  float highBound,
                                  int[] results)
        Attempts to get an investment by its price. Compares investments' prices by lowBound and highBound. Comparisons are inclusive for both lowBound and highBound. Stores indices of found investments within array of integers.
        Parameters:
        lowBound - The lower bound to compare against, greater than or equal to 0 and lower than or equal to highBound.
        highBound - The higher bound to compare against, greater than or equal to lowBound and lower than or equal to Integer.MaxValue.
        results - The integer array to store the results of the search. Indices are set (=1) if the investment at the index matched the bounds and cleared (=0) if not. Should be of length equal to ArrayList of Investments.
        Returns:
        Boolean value of whether any investment was within the bounds.

      • Load

        private void Load​(java.lang.String filename)
        Attempts to load investments from a file, specified by 'filename' into the portfolio. Checks if the file exists, and if it contains characters. Reads single lines from the file, storing each into an array of type String, and incrementing a counter variable. When all lines for an investment have been read and stored, the investment is created as a Stock or MutualFund object by parsing the stored Strings, and is added to the 'investments' ArrayList before continuing to read the file.
        Parameters:
        filename - The name of the file to load.

      • Exit

        public static void Exit()
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Attempt to save the portfolio to a file, specified by 'inFilename'. Creates a new file if none existed, and clears preexisting file. Writes all Investment objects to file using the Investment.toFileString() method and a StringBuilder for more efficient concatenation of a varying number of Strings.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Several exceptions can be encountered, when attempting to create a new file, based on 'filename', when creating the PrintWriter object based on the file 'f', and when formatting the Investment object String representation during the writing.

      • GetInvestment

        public static Investment GetInvestment​(int index)
        Gets a copy of an Investment object from the "investments" ArrayList by index.
        Parameters:
        index - The index to get an Investment from.
        Returns:
        A copy of an Investment object.

      • Size

        public static int Size()
        Get the size of the "investments" ArrayList.
        Returns:
        Size of the "investments" ArrayList.
